meanings.definition: To remove from the center of activity or attention.
meanings.sent1: The coach was sidelining the injured player to keep him safe.
meanings.sent2: She was sidelining her phone during the meeting to avoid distractions.
meanings.sent3: The cat was sidelining the noisy toy by pushing it under the couch.
meanings.sent4: The storm was sidelining the outdoor event, forcing everyone inside.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was sidelining the disruptive student to maintain class focus.

meanings.definition: To prevent from participating in something.
meanings.sent1: The strict rules were sidelining many students from the competition.
meanings.sent2: He felt frustrated when his injury sidelined him from the important match.
meanings.sent3: The rain was sidelining the picnic, making everyone stay indoors.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure was sidelining her from trying new things.
meanings.sent5: The broken car sidelined them from reaching the destination on time.

meanings.definition: The act of putting someone or something on the sidelines.
meanings.sent1: The sidelining of the star player surprised the fans.
meanings.sent2: She felt disappointed by the sidelining of her ideas in the project.
meanings.sent3: The sidelining of the old equipment led to delays in production.
meanings.sent4: The sidelining of the main character in the story changed the plot dramatically.
meanings.sent5: The sidelining of the proposal left many unanswered questions.
